description: Provides a complete mapping from the public accelerator IP address and port to destination EC2 instance IP addresses and ports in the virtual public cloud (VPC) subnet endpoint for a custom routing accelerator. For each subnet endpoint that you add, Global Accelerator creates a new static port mapping for the accelerator. The port mappings don't change after Global Accelerator generates them, so you can retrieve and cache the full mapping on your servers. If you remove a subnet from your accelerator, Global Accelerator removes (reclaims) the port mappings. If you add a subnet to your accelerator, Global Accelerator creates new port mappings (the existing ones don't change). If you add or remove EC2 instances in your subnet, the port mappings don't change, because the mappings are created when you add the subnet to Global Accelerator. The mappings also include a flag for each destination denoting which destination IP addresses and ports are allowed or denied traffic.

parameters.name: AcceleratorArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the accelerator to list the custom routing port mappings for.

nested_items.name: PortMappings
nested_items.description: The port mappings for a custom routing accelerator.

nested_items.name: EndpointGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.

nested_items.name: EndpointId
nested_items.description: The IP address of the VPC subnet (the subnet ID).

nested_items.name: DestinationSocketAddress
nested_items.description: The EC2 instance IP address and port number in the virtual private cloud (VPC) subnet.

nested_items.name: IpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address for the socket address.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port for the socket address.

nested_items.name: Protocols
nested_items.description: The protocols supported by the endpoint group.

nested_items.name: DestinationTrafficState
nested_items.description: Indicates whether or not a port mapping destination can receive traffic. The value is either ALLOW, if traffic is allowed to the destination, or DENY, if traffic is not allowed to the destination.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token for the next set of results. You receive this token from a previous call.
